ratings.comment: Professor Rosengren has been my favorite professor at UW. His lectures are engaging and informative. I wish I could have the opportunity to take another class with him.

Karl is a great lecturer, professor, person. This class was very difficult but I would take it from him again. Most grading is done by TAs, they worked hard but were not awesome. Get ready to complete a ton of work with a group that may or may not let you down. Only bad thing- he wrote a brand new textbook that you HAVE to buy, not available used.

Prof. Rosengren is an incredible teacher. When studying for exams, I found myself remembering things he said in class verbatim due to his highly engaging speaking style and evident passion. Material is easy but fascinating, and critical for understanding people & psychology as a whole, not just children. The best professor I have had at UW.

Strives to teach us how to be better parents, teachers, coaches, etc. someday, which is something not a lot of other people would ever teach you. Makes maybe 20% of the tests based on discussions we have in lecture, so it is important to go to lecture
Very engaged lecturer. Makes the material that more interesting. Only 2 tests and 4 small papers. I highly enjoyed this class

I really enjoyed his lectures and his teaching style! He keeps you engaged in class with discussions and is willing to answer questions in class. The exams are very fair and he always throws a fun extra credit question on there. Make sure to go to class, lectures are not posted online. If not, read the book.

Professor Rosengren was by far my favorite professor I've had at UW. He is so knowledgable about the material and I can tell that he genuinely wants us to succeed. If I could take every class at UW with him, I so would. 10/10 recommend!

Karl is a super great guy and a very good professor. The material itself is okay, a little dry with all the theories and what not, but he makes them more tolerable. He assigns a few mini papers and biweekly quizzes that help your grade. Exams a difficult but very fair. He genuinely wants to see us succeed, I highly recommend him and the class!

One of the best professors at UW. Has an excellent grasp on the subject. Articulate, in-depth and intriguing lectures. Each lecture motivates you to attend the next. Never felt bored during any lecture. Had at least one "Aha" moment in every lecture. Doesn't make you buy text, puts it online for a cheap price. Exams are MCQs based on lecture + text

Truly and amazing professor.  I'm so glad that I decided to take research methods with him, because Rosengren makes the most dreaded psych class doable and interesting.  The class is project heavy with a few tests that count for about a third of your overall grade.  If you have to take the class definitely take it with him.

His tests are difficult but very fair. Most people get tripped up by the length of the questions. His lectures are well done and he explains things thoroughly, however you need to attend lecture as he does not post his lecture slides anywhere.

Prof. Rosengren really knows the stuff he teaches, and the class is overall very interesting and insightful, the only thing I would I would knock off is how fast he lectures. You must be prepared to take lots of notes in a short amount of time, but most of the time the material is in the textbook. The tests are weighted heavy, but aren't terrible.

Karl is amazing; one of the best prof at UW. He is so incredibly knowledgeable and passionate, I felt inspired often. I've been telling so many about his class. Of the countless classes I had taken and loved, if I could get the general public to attend only one course, this would be it. Content is powerful--you will be changed!

This should not be a difficult class, however for some reason they make it SO much work. There are a ton of little online quizzes that are specific af and that aren't supposed to have a huge impact on your overall grade, but they actually do. We also have to write four 150 word papers that are barely worth anything. Honestly, hated this class.

Karl Rosengren was one of my favorite professors at UW. He cares very deeply about subject matter, and additionally about his student's success. I would definitely recommend him, he made child development very interesting.

I really enjoyed this class. He is a great lecturer and tests are fair. He really wants you to learn the material and sometimes gives time for discussion and questions during class. Seriously, everyone who wants to be a parent should take Psych 560. I definitely recommend Rosengren!

Karl is a great professor! I was pretty nervous about Research Methods because of everyone telling me how hard it would be, but he made it  interesting (on a topic like this, that's pretty impressive) and more than doable. Would not take this class with anyone else.
Rosey is one of the best in the psych department. Guy is incredibly fair, tests are very straightforward, and he honestly cares about students. Don't take anyone else

Absolutely fantastic professor.  Made potentially the most difficult psychology class requirement (research methods) bearable and fun.  He is enthusiastic and beyond helpful when it comes to course material.  The class has a large workload (a project just about every week), but it's perfectly doable.  Highly recommend taking it with Prof. Rosengren
Very good prof

He's a good lecturer, but he goes through slides very quickly and it's difficult to get all of the information down. VERY LONG TESTS, though overall fair. Lots of extra credit opportunities, though you can only choose a few. Only one essay throughout semester. Gives study guides for midterms. Very personable.  Definitely recommend his course.

Rosengren is very knowledgeable, having done many well renowned developmental psych experiments and research himself. The online system he uses is kind of spotty and inconsistent. The tests and quizzes are based almost entirely off the book as well as specifics from lecture so this class is some work. Still, I found him to be a great professor !

Karl is such a great professor. He definitely knows his stuff, but his lectures can be long and contain a lot of material. Showing up to lecture is key to passing. His class should be mandatory to anyone who plans on having kids or working with them in the future. I would definitely take this course again!

Having recently declared psychology, this was my first upper level class taken and I'm glad it was with Professor Rosengren. You should tell from lecture to lecture he is very passionate about what he is teaching. His personality made students very comfortable to ask questions and interact during class. Loved having Professor Rosengren!

Rosengren is a very fair and nice guy. He understands that we all have a lot going on besides this class. Not much studying is needed if you'd like a B/BC, I had to study a lot to get A's on the exams though. Lectures got long sometimes and he talked a little too quickly occasionally.  Overall, I really liked professor Rosengren and would recomend

Rosengren is awesome. By far one of the best professors I've had here. Even if you aren't a psych major, I recommend taking this class because it's applicable to everyone's life. Rosengren makes power lectures bearable! Weekly reading isn't bad at all plus online quizzes which come straight from reading. TESTS ARE TOUGH. Super wordy. Study!!!
I loved going to Professor Rosengren's lectures. He is so knowledgable and is always willing to answer questions. I highly recommend this class and I would love to take another class with Rosengren!

As a Freshman in a 560 course I was scared that this course would be too much but it's really not with how Rosengren teaches it. There's about 40 pages of reading a week and online quizzes but they're easily doable. The exams aren't too hard as long as you go to lecture and read (he also has review sessions and guides). Overall, great class!!

Professor Rosengren is amazing! I loved listening to him speak, and he kept my interest throughout the entire power lecture. This class helped me decided what path I want to take in my psychology career. I wish he taught more classes that I could take! He is very down to earth and understands we do have other commitments outside of his class.

Try to take this class if you can!  It's applicable to your life if you plan on having kids or a career that requires you to work with kids.  I'm a pre nursing student and took this as my G&D and I recommend this class to take for that pre req.  It seems intimidating, but I promise it's not hard! Try to take it after 202-a lot of info repeats.

Karl was a fantastic professor who was clearly passionate about the material. I could seriously listen to him talk all day. He picked interesting topics of devo psych (fantasy, drawings) to cover in addition to the basic ones. Reading the book is a must. Tests are tricky, but he's a fair grader. Don't skip assignments because they help your grade!

Lectures are essential to attend since he doesn't post notes or anything really online, and if you miss anything he holds review sessions before exams where you can ask questions. I did well in the class, but he's not always clear on what will be on exams.
Be sure to read the book!

Karl is a great guy with material he clearly loves teaching. I invite my friends to lecture often just so they can hear him teach. His research is also really interesting, which he cites often. Exams are really tough, make sure you read the textbook and attend lecture and you should get at least a B. Getting an A requires going above and beyond.
